groups.name: spring.python.executor.graalpy
groups.description: Configuration properties for the GraalPy-based Python executor integration.

properties.name: spring.python.executor.graalpy.enabled
properties.description: Whether the GraalPy executor autoconfiguration is enabled.

properties.name: spring.python.executor.graalpy.result-appearance
properties.description: Defines the variable name of the result returned from Python to Java.

properties.name: spring.python.executor.graalpy.cached
properties.description: Whether GraalPy sources should be cached.

properties.name: spring.python.executor.graalpy.host-access
properties.description: Specifies the level of Java host access available to GraalPy scripts.

properties.name: spring.python.executor.graalpy.allow-value-sharing
properties.description: Whether values may be shared across GraalPy contexts.

properties.name: spring.python.executor.graalpy.allow-experimental-options
properties.description: Allows usage of experimental GraalPy configuration options.

properties.name: spring.python.executor.graalpy.additional-options
properties.description: Additional custom GraalPy context options provided as key-value pairs.

values.description: Recommended variable name for Python-to-Java result passing (default).
Provides unrestricted access to Java host classes and members.
Allows host access only where explicitly annotated.
Allows scoped access to selected Java members.
Restricts host access to a safe, limited subset.
Provides isolated access with strict boundaries.
Safe mode designed for untrusted Python code.
Disables all access to Java host classes (default).
Controls how .pyc hash-based bytecode files are checked: 'default', 'always', or 'never'.
Selects backend for compression modules (zlib, bz2, lzma).
Overrides the location of the Python core library home directory.
Sets the Python home directory (equivalent to GRAAL_PYTHONHOME).
Equivalent to Python '-B': do not write .pyc bytecode files ('true'/'false').
Enable Jython-like behaviors (may affect performance) ('true'/'false').
Equivalent to Python '-E': ignore PYTHON* environment variables ('true'/'false').
Install default Python signal handlers on startup ('true'/'false').
Equivalent to Python '-I': isolate from environment on import path ('true'/'false').
Equivalent to Python '-S': do not automatically import 'site' ('true'/'false').
Specify an alternate prefix path for .pyc cache directories.
Overrides sys.base_prefix for the embedded Python instance.
Allows GraalPy to emulate another platform ('windows', 'macos', or 'linux') when running on an unsupported platform.
Specifies the command used by the venv launcher.
Print warnings for experimental features at runtime ('true' or 'false').
Equivalent to Python '-i': inspect interactively after running script ('true'/'false').
Suppress the interpreter-only warning when runtime compilation to native code is not available ('true'/'false').
Set the maximum heap size for the polyglot engine. Accepts JVM-style memory values, e.g., '512m'.
Graal engine mode. Possible values: 'latency' or 'throughput'.
Enable Graal runtime compilation ('true' or 'false').
Enable Graal multi-tier compilation ('true' or 'false').
